register.power_domain_text: When FEAT_DoPD is implemented, EDPRSR is in the Core power domain. Otherwise, EDPRSR contains fields that are in the Core power domain and fields that are in the Debug power domain

reg_access_state.reg_access_level: When FEAT_DoPD is not implemented or IsCorePowered()

purpose_text.para: Holds information about the reset and powerdown state of the PE.

configuration_text.para: If is implemented then all fields in this register are in the Core power domain.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
External Performance Monitors Access Disable Extended Status. Together with EDPRSR.EPMAD, reports whether access to Performance Monitor registers by an external debugger is permitted.
For a description of the values derived by evaluating EPMAD and EPMADE together, see EDPRSR.EPMAD.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_RME is implemented and FEAT_PMUv3_EXT is implemented

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
External Trace Access Disable Extended Status. Together with EDPRSR.ETAD, reports whether access to trace unit registers by an external debugger is permitted.
For a description of the values derived by evaluating ETAD and ETADE together, see EDPRSR.ETAD.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_RME is implemented, FEAT_TRC_EXT is implemented and FEAT_TRBE is implemented

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
External Debug Access Disable Extended Status. Together with EDPRSR.EDAD, reports whether access to breakpoint registers, watchpoint registers, and OSLAR_EL1 by an external debugger is permitted.
For a description of the values derived by evaluating EDAD and EDADE together, see EDPRSR.EDAD.
Reserved, RES0.
Sticky ETAD error. Set to 1 when a Non-secure external debug interface access to an external trace register returns an error because AllowExternalTraceAccess() == FALSE for the access.
If IsCorePowered() == TRUE, the Core power domain is powered up, then, following a read of EDPRSR:

listitem.content: If is not implemented or DoubleLockStatus() == FALSE then this bit clears to 0.
If is implemented and DoubleLockStatus() == TRUE then it is CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE whether this bit clears to 0 or is unchanged.

field_description.para: This bit is in the Core power domain.

note.para: If is implemented, is not implemented.

field_value_description.para: Since EDPRSR was last read, no external accesses to the trace unit registers have failed because AllowExternalTraceAccess() was FALSE for the access.
Since EDPRSR was last read, at least one external access to the trace unit registers has failed because AllowExternalTraceAccess() was FALSE for the access.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_TRC_EXT is implemented and FEAT_TRBE is implemented

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
External Trace Access Disable Status. Together with EDPRSR.ETADE, reports whether access to trace unit registers by an external debugger is permitted.

row.entry: ETADE
ETAD
Meaning
Access to trace unit registers by an external debugger is permitted.
Root and Secure access to trace unit registers by an external debugger is permitted. Realm and Non-secure access to trace unit registers by an external debugger is not permitted.
Root and Realm access to trace unit registers by an external debugger is permitted. Secure and Non-secure access to trace unit registers by an external debugger is not permitted.
Root access to trace unit registers by an external debugger is permitted. Secure, Non-secure, and Realm access to trace unit registers by an external debugger is not permitted.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_RME is implemented, FEAT_TRC_EXT is implemented and FEAT_TRBE is implemented

field_description.para: External Trace Access Disable status.
This bit is in the Core power domain.

note.para: If is implemented, is not implemented.

field_value_description.para: External Non-secure trace unit accesses enabled. AllowExternalTraceAccess() == TRUE for a Non-secure access.
External Non-secure trace unit accesses disabled. AllowExternalTraceAccess() == FALSE for a Non-secure access.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_TRC_EXT is implemented and FEAT_TRBE is implemented

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Sticky Debug Restart. Set to 1 when the PE exits Debug state.
Permitted values are:

note.para: If a reset occurs when the PE is in Debug state, the PE exits Debug state. SDR is UNKNOWN on Warm reset, meaning a debugger must also use the SR bit to determine whether the PE has left Debug state.

field_description.para: If the Core power domain is powered up, then following a read of EDPRSR:

listitem.content: If is not implemented or DoubleLockStatus() == FALSE this bit clears to 0.
If is implemented and DoubleLockStatus() == TRUE, it is CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE whether this bit clears to 0 or is unchanged.

field_description.para: This field is in the Core power domain.

field_value_description.para: The PE has not restarted since EDPRSR was last read.
The PE has restarted since EDPRSR was last read.

field_description.para: Sticky EPMAD error. Set to 1 if an external debug interface access to a Performance Monitors register returns an error because AllowExternalPMUAccess() == FALSE.
Permitted values are:
If the Core power domain is powered up, then following a read of EDPRSR:

listitem.content: If is not implemented or DoubleLockStatus() == FALSE, this bit clears to 0.
If is implemented and DoubleLockStatus() == TRUE, it is CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE whether this bit clears to 0 or is unchanged.

field_description.para: This field is in the Core power domain.

field_value_description.para: No Non-secure external debug interface accesses to the external Performance Monitors registers have failed because AllowExternalPMUAccess() == FALSE for the access since EDPRSR was last read.

At least one Non-secure external debug interface access to the external Performance Monitors register has failed and returned an error because AllowExternalPMUAccess() == FALSE for the access since EDPRSR was last read.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_Debugv8p4 is implemented and FEAT_PMUv3_EXT is implemented

field_description.para: Sticky EPMAD error.
If the Core power domain is powered up, then, following a read of EDPRSR:

listitem.content: If is not implemented or DoubleLockStatus() == FALSE, this bit clears to 0.
If is implemented, and DoubleLockStatus() == TRUE, it is CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE whether this bit clears to 0 or is unchanged.

field_description.para: This field is in the Core power domain.

field_value_description.para: No external debug interface accesses to the Performance Monitors registers have failed because AllowExternalPMUAccess() == FALSE since EDPRSR was last read.
At least one external debug interface access to the Performance Monitors registers has failed and returned an error because AllowExternalPMUAccess() == FALSE since EDPRSR was last read.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
External Performance Monitors Access Disable Status. Together with EDPRSR.EPMADE, reports whether access to Performance Monitor registers by an external debugger is permitted.

row.entry: EPMADE
EPMAD
Meaning
Access to Performance Monitor registers by an external debugger is permitted.
Root and Secure access to Performance Monitor registers by an external debugger is permitted. Realm and Non-secure access to Performance Monitor registers by an external debugger is not permitted.
Root and Realm access to Performance Monitor registers by an external debugger is permitted. Secure and Non-secure access to Performance Monitor registers by an external debugger is not permitted.
Root access to Performance Monitor registers by an external debugger is permitted. Secure, Non-secure, and Realm access to Performance Monitor registers by an external debugger is not permitted.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_RME is implemented and FEAT_PMUv3_EXT is implemented

field_description.para: External Performance Monitors Non-secure Access Disable status.
This field is in the Core power domain.

field_value_description.para: External Non-secure Performance Monitors access enabled. AllowExternalPMUAccess() == TRUE for a Non-secure access.
External Non-secure Performance Monitors access disabled. AllowExternalPMUAccess() == FALSE for a Non-secure access.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_Debugv8p4 is implemented and FEAT_PMUv3_EXT is implemented

field_description.para: External Performance Monitors access disable status.
This field is in the Core power domain.

field_value_description.para: External Performance Monitors access enabled. AllowExternalPMUAccess() == TRUE.
External Performance Monitors access disabled. AllowExternalPMUAccess() == FALSE.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_PMUv3_EXT is implemented and FEAT_Debugv8p4 is not implemented

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Sticky EDAD error. Set to 1 if an external debug interface access to a debug register returns an error because AllowExternalDebugAccess() == FALSE.
If the Core power domain is powered up, then, following a read of EDPRSR:

listitem.content: If is not implemented or DoubleLockStatus() == FALSE this bit clears to 0.
If is implemented and DoubleLockStatus() == TRUE, it is CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE whether this bit clears to 0 or is unchanged.

field_description.para: This field is in the Core power domain.

field_value_description.para: No Non-secure external debug interface accesses to the debug registers have failed because AllowExternalDebugAccess() == FALSE for the access since EDPRSR was last read.
At least one Non-secure external debug interface access to the debug registers has failed and returned an error because AllowExternalDebugAccess() == FALSE for the access since EDPRSR was last read.

field_description.para: Sticky EDAD error. Set to 1 if an external debug interface access to a debug register returns an error because AllowExternalDebugAccess() == FALSE.
If the Core power domain is powered up, then, following a read of EDPRSR:

listitem.content: If is not implemented or DoubleLockStatus() == FALSE this bit clears to 0.
If is implemented and DoubleLockStatus() == TRUE, it is CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE whether this bit clears to 0 or is unchanged.

field_description.para: This bit is UNKNOWN on reads if OSLockStatus() == TRUE and external debug writes to OSLAR_EL1 do not return an error when AllowExternalDebugAccess() == FALSE.
This field is in the Core power domain.

field_value_description.para: No external debug interface accesses to the debug registers have failed because AllowExternalDebugAccess() == FALSE since EDPRSR was last read.
At least one external debug interface access to the debug registers has failed and returned an error because AllowExternalDebugAccess() == FALSE since EDPRSR was last read.

field_description.para: External Debug Access Disable Status. Together with EDPRSR.EDADE, reports whether access to breakpoint registers, watchpoint registers, and OSLAR_EL1 by an external debugger is permitted.

row.entry: EDADE
EDAD
Meaning
Access to Debug registers by an external debugger is permitted.
Root and Secure access to Debug registers by an external debugger is permitted. Realm and Non-secure access to Debug registers by an external debugger is not permitted.
Root and Realm access to Debug registers by an external debugger is permitted. Secure and Non-secure access to Debug registers by an external debugger is not permitted.
Root access to Debug registers by an external debugger is permitted. Secure, Non-secure, and Realm access to Debug registers by an external debugger is not permitted.

field_description.para: External Debug Access Disable status.
This field is in the Core power domain.

field_value_description.para: External Non-secure access to breakpoint registers, watchpoint registers, and OSLAR_EL1 enabled. AllowExternalDebugAccess() == TRUE for a Non-secure access.
External Non-secure access to breakpoint registers, watchpoint registers, and OSLAR_EL1 disabled. AllowExternalDebugAccess() == FALSE for a Non-secure access.

field_description.para: External Debug Access Disable status.
This bit is not valid and reads UNKNOWN if OSLockStatus() == TRUE and external debug writes to OSLAR_EL1 do not return an error when AllowExternalDebugAccess() == FALSE.
This field is in the Core power domain.

field_value_description.para: External access to breakpoint registers, watchpoint registers, and OSLAR_EL1 enabled. AllowExternalDebugAccess() == TRUE.
External access to breakpoint registers, watchpoint registers, and OSLAR_EL1 disabled. AllowExternalDebugAccess() == FALSE.

field_description.para: External Debug Access Disable status.
This field is in the Core power domain.

field_value_description.para: External access to breakpoint registers, watchpoint registers, and OSLAR_EL1 enabled. AllowExternalDebugAccess() == TRUE.
External access to breakpoint registers, watchpoint registers disabled. It is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED whether accesses to OSLAR_EL1 are enabled or disabled. AllowExternalDebugAccess() == FALSE.

field_description.para: This field is RES0.
Double Lock.
From Armv8.2, this field is deprecated.
This field is in the Core power domain.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_Debugv8p2 is implemented and FEAT_DoubleLock is implemented

field_description.para: Double Lock.
This field returns the result of the pseudocode function DoubleLockStatus().
If the Core power domain is powered up and DoubleLockStatus() == TRUE, it is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED whether:

listitem.content: EDPRSR.PU reads as 1, EDPRSR.DLK reads as 1, and EDPRSR.SPD is UNKNOWN.
EDPRSR.PU reads as 0, EDPRSR.DLK is UNKNOWN, and EDPRSR.SPD reads as 0.

field_description.para: This field is in the Core power domain.

field_value_description.para: DoubleLockStatus() returns FALSE.
DoubleLockStatus() returns TRUE and the Core power domain is powered up.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
OS Lock status bit.
A read of this bit returns the value of OSLSR_EL1.OSLK.
This field is in the Core power domain.
Halted status bit.
This field is in the Core power domain.

field_value_description.para: PE is in Non-debug state.
PE is in Debug state.

field_description.para: Sticky core Reset status bit.
Permitted values are:

If EDPRSR.PU reads as 1 and EDPRSR.R reads as 0, which means that the Core power domain is in a powerup state and that the non-debug logic of the PE is not in reset state, then following a read of EDPRSR:

listitem.content: If is not implemented or DoubleLockStatus() == FALSE this bit clears to 0.
If is implemented and DoubleLockStatus() == TRUE, it is CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE whether this bit clears to 0 or is unchanged.

field_description.para: This field is in the Core power domain.

field_value_description.para: The non-debug logic of the PE is not in reset state and has not been reset since the last time EDPRSR was read.
The non-debug logic of the PE is in reset state or has been reset since the last time EDPRSR was read.

field_description.para: PE Reset status bit.
Permitted values are:
If is implemented, the PE is in reset state, and the PE entered reset state with the OS Double Lock locked this bit has a CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE value. For more information, see .
This field is in the Core power domain.

field_value_description.para: The non-debug logic of the PE is not in reset state.
The non-debug logic of the PE is in reset state.

field_description.para: Sticky core Powerdown status bit.
If is implemented and DoubleLockStatus() == TRUE, then:

listitem.content: If is implemented, this bit reads as 0.
If is not implemented, this bit might read as 0 or 1.

field_description.para: For more information, see .
If the Core power domain is powered up, then, following a read of EDPRSR:

listitem.content: If is not implemented or DoubleLockStatus() == FALSE this bit clears to 0.
If is implemented and DoubleLockStatus() == TRUE, it is CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE whether this bit clears to 0 or is unchanged.

field_description.para: When is not implemented and the Core power domain is in either retention or powerdown state, the value of EDPRSR.SPD is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED. For more information, see .
EDPRSR.{DLK, SPD, PU} describe whether registers in the Core power domain can be accessed, and whether their state has been lost since the last time the register was read. For more information, see .
This field is in the Core power domain.

field_value_description.para: If EDPRSR.PU is 0, it is not known whether the state of the debug registers in the Core power domain is lost.
If EDPRSR.PU is 1, the state of the debug registers in the Core power domain has not been lost.
The state of the debug registers in the Core power domain has been lost.

field_description.para: Core powerup status bit.
Core Powerup status bit. Indicates whether the debug registers in the Core power domain can be accessed.
If is implemented, the PE is in reset state, and the PE entered reset state with the OS Double Lock locked this bit has a CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE value. For more information, see
EDPRSR.{DLK, SPD, PU} describe whether registers in the Core power domain can be accessed, and whether their state has been lost since the last time the register was read. For more information, see

field_value_description.para: Either the Core power domain is in a low-power or powerdown state, or is implemented and DoubleLockStatus() == TRUE, meaning the debug registers in the Core power domain cannot be accessed.
The Core power domain is in a powerup state, and either is not implemented or DoubleLockStatus() == FALSE, meaning the debug registers in the Core power domain can be accessed.

field_description.para: Core Powerup status bit. Indicates whether the debug registers in the Core power domain can be accessed.
When the Core power domain is powered-up and DoubleLockStatus() == TRUE, then the value of EDPRSR.PU is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED. See the description of the DLK bit for more information.
Otherwise, permitted values are:
If is implemented, the Core power domain is powered up, and DoubleLockStatus() == TRUE, it is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED whether this bit reads as 0 or 1.
If is implemented, the PE is in reset state, and the PE entered reset state with the OS Double Lock locked this bit has a CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE value. For more information see
EDPRSR.{DLK, SPD, PU} describe whether registers in the Core power domain can be accessed, and whether their state has been lost since the last time the register was read. For more information, see .

field_value_description.para: Core power domain is in a low-power or powerdown state where the debug registers in the Core power domain cannot be accessed.
Core power domain is in a powerup state where the debug registers in the Core power domain can be accessed.

access_permission_text.para: On permitted accesses to the register, other access controls affect the behavior of some fields. See the field descriptions for more information.
If the Core power domain is powered up (EDPRSR.PU == 1), then following a read of EDPRSR:

listitem.content: If is not implemented or DoubleLockStatus() == FALSE, then: EDPRSR.{SDR, SPMAD, SDAD, SPD} are cleared to 0. EDPRSR.SR is cleared to 0 if the non-debug logic of the PE is not in reset state (EDPRSR.R == 0).
If is implemented and DoubleLockStatus() == TRUE, it is CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE whether or not this clearing occurs.

access_permission_text.para: If is not implemented and the Core power domain is powered down (EDPRSR.PU == 0), then:

listitem.content: EDPRSR.{SDR, SPMAD, SDAD, SR} are all UNKNOWN, and are either reset or restored on being powered up.
EDPRSR.SPD is not cleared following a read of EDPRSR. See the SPD bit description for more information.

access_permission_text.para: The clearing of bits is an indirect write to EDPRSR.
